messages: 2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:09): anyone knows what the best way is to update a resizeable shape in a canvas?
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:10): right now i keep the pixel-state of the canvas before the element is placed, and refresh the canvas with that every time
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:10): wonder if webworkers can have any speedgain with this
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:15): 2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c: have you seen fabric.js?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:15): you could probably glean some ideas from it: https://github.com/kangax/fabric.js
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:17): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b: hey thanks!
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:18): yea, i need somethinge like that
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:19): thats some pretty impressive performance as well
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:19): really nice library
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:20): great, mit licensed :)
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:20): i wonder how it's so fast
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:24): kangax did a talk on it last night
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:25): lemme find the slides
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:25): http://www.slideshare.net/kangax/fabricjs-building-acanvaslibrarybk
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:27): impressive stuff
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:28): probably it would still be useful to keep multiple canvas elements to support multi-layer paint
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:28): does it support svg import by the way?
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:29): ah got it. it does :)
e4d6e7f4fcaff24a1d65b9d2de57f23d (17:44): wow, this fabric.js looks pretty useful
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:44): yea, i thought the same :)
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:45): i can really use such a thing in my collab painting app
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:45): wonder if it can export to svg as well
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:46): i think that's planned
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:46): thats pretty awesome
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:46): edit in a webbrowser or in inkscape :)
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:46): but it can serialize the canvas state and rebuild it, etc
e4d6e7f4fcaff24a1d65b9d2de57f23d (17:46): I could use it in my multilang news editor. As I can see it takes care of few canvas bugs (or not bugs, just advanced things)
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:46): so you can save the paining in a db, or pass it via websockets, etc
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (17:46): s/paining/painting/
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:47): yea, thats what im currently try to do as well, but its a disadvantage not having canvas available on the serverside as well
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:48): ideally i would like to push the canvas state directly, instead of rebuilding from the operation log
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:48): there is some canvas implementation for node.js using cairo. hope something like that will be there for py as well
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:48): its probably limited to some basic operations
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (17:49): anyway, one thing at a time :(

cb416736768cccda08fec33aad33be9c (17:57): Hi. Not sure this is the right place, but I‚Äôd like to parse HTML5 from python. Is there any difference between html5lib.parse(source, treebuilder="lxml") and lxml.html.html5parser.fromstring(source) ?
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:12): there is no room for modernizr?
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:12): where can i get help?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:16): whatcha need?
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:17): well i simply want to use border-radius with firefox 3.6
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:17): the documentation is obscure, cant understand it
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:17): ok, that should just work, no?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:17): -moz-border-radius: 10px, etc
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:18): so modernizer does not do it for me?
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:18): i must go and type it?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:18): no, modernizr just detects if your UA is capable
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:18): hahaha
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:18): damm, all that i heard were lies
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:19): </troll>
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:19): so how do i do to make ff 3.6 use border radius now?
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:19): create a seperate css file?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:19): what i just typed
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:19): why a different css file?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:19): if the browser doesn't understand it, it'll just ignore it
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:20): ?g MDC border-radius @ 835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (18:20): 835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef, border-radius - MDC Doc Center - https://developer.mozilla.org/en/CSS/border-radius
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:20): because ff4, chrome 10 and ie9 understands border-radius 15px, so i want to keep it that way

3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (18:20): new version of my pacman in webgl at http://pacmaze.com (for details see http://notes 3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298.com/2011/04/20/pacmaze-v2-even-more-WebGL-in-pacman.html)
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:21): you are telling me to use both border-radius and moz-border-radius inside my tag?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:21): right 835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef, add the -moz- vendor prefix
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:21): yeah
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:21): -webkit- too if you want older chromes/safaris to work
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:22): just forget ie7 and 8 and rounded corners
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:22): there's JS solutions...but who cares
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:22): but i want em
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:24): well then, google for them
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:25): i don't know any off hand
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:25): ok, thanks though
835fa9fd1602ebf1745d427952f491ef (18:28): ff3.6 does take rgba() nah?
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:36): um, probably
